alert.note: Alert for Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 6:07AM CDT until March 26 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Mississippi... Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown affecting Pike and Walthall Counties. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Franklinton, Bush...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Secondary roads in the vicinity of the river will flood. Homes close to the river and portions of the Hidden Springs Resort Park will be flooded. Low-lying farm and pasture land near the river will remain flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM CDT Thursday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.0 feet this evening and then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.1 feet on 01/01/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
